page.title: 03MARYCULTER Farm.Kingcausie
page.content: Kingcausie Estate is owned by the Fortescue family whose ancestors have lived in the area almost since the time of Domesday Book. The estate comprises 2,000 acres: 1200 farmland,600 woodland and 200 rough ground. There are 25 houses with some 70-80 people living there. The family have interested themselves in the preservation of the countryside. A large scale replanting of trees was undertaken after hundreds were chopped down to provide timber in two world wars. Sadly, in the great gale of 1953 more were destroyed but again planting has taken place. The name means "hill of pine trees" and besides that being assured many beautiful deciduous trees provide habitat for a variety of birds and small animals.
